programs.howToGetIt: Present your EBT card at the admissions desk. Discount applies to everyone in your party. Advance tickets recommended on weekends and during school breaks.
programs.address: 201 South Market Street, San Jose, CA 95113

programs.name: Walt Disney Family Museum
programs.description: The Walt Disney Family Museum in San Francisco's Presidio tells the story of Walt Disney's life through interactive galleries featuring original artwork, early drawings, films, music, and a stunning model of Disneyland.
programs.fullDescription: The Walt Disney Family Museum in San Francisco's Presidio tells the story of Walt Disney's life through interactive galleries featuring original artwork, early drawings, films, music, and a stunning model of Disneyland.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- US Military/Dependents: Free general admission with ID
- Museums for All: Reduced admission for SF EBT/CalFresh/Medi-Cal holders
- Discount covers cardholder plus guests
- Students with ID: $25 admission
- Seniors (65+): $25 admission
- Children 6-17: $20 admission
- Children under 6: Free with adult
- Regular admission: $30 adults
programs.howToGetIt: For military free admission, show valid military or dependent ID. For Museums for All, present your SF benefits card and proof of SF residency at the admissions desk.
programs.address: 104 Montgomery Street, Presidio of San Francisco, CA 94129

programs.name: 7-Eleven Gold Pass
programs.description: 40% off ($5.99/month) Gold Pass membership for EBT/SNAP recipients, military/veterans, and college students (verify eligibility via mobile app under 'Community Discounts'); 30-day free trial for new customers
programs.fullDescription: 7-Eleven is one of the world's largest convenience store chains. Their Gold Pass membership offers exclusive deals, rewards, and discounts on food, drinks, and everyday items.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- 40% off Gold Pass membership ($5.99/month instead of regular price)
- Available for EBT/SNAP recipients, military/veterans, and college students
- Exclusive member deals on food, drinks, and snacks
- 30-day free trial for new customers
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Download the 7-Eleven app on your smartphone
2. Create an account or sign in
3. Go to 'Community Discounts' in the app settings
4. Verify your eligibility (EBT card, military ID, or .edu email)
5. Start your discounted membership

programs.name: Amazon Prime Access
programs.description: Prime membership for $6.99/month for eligible government assistance recipients or income verified customers; new customers start with a free 30-day trial
programs.fullDescription: Amazon is the world's largest online retailer. Prime Access offers a discounted Prime membership for those receiving government assistance, providing free shipping, streaming, and more.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Discounted Prime membership at $6.99/month (regularly $14.99/month)
- Free two-day shipping on millions of items
- Prime Video streaming (movies, TV shows)
- Prime Music, Prime Reading, and more
- 30-day free trial for new customers
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Visit amazon.com/primeaccess
2. Verify eligibility through EBT card or government assistance documentation
3. Or verify income through a third-party service
4. Complete enrollment and start your membership
5. Re-verify eligibility every 12 months

programs.name: AT&T Access
programs.description: Affordable internet with free installation
programs.fullDescription: AT&T is one of the largest telecommunications companies in the United States. AT&T Access provides affordable high-speed internet service to qualifying low-income households.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Affordable high-speed internet service
- Free installation (no installation fees)
- No annual contract required
- In-home WiFi included
- Access to AT&T WiFi hotspots
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check if AT&T service is available at your address
2. Verify eligibility through SNAP, SSI, or other qualifying programs
3. Apply online at att.com/access or call customer service
4. Schedule installation appointment
5. No credit check required

programs.name: California LifeLine Program
programs.description: Discounted or free phone and wireless service
programs.fullDescription: California LifeLine is a state program that provides discounted home phone and cell phone services to eligible low-income households, ensuring everyone has access to basic communication services.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Discounted or free home phone service
- Discounted or free cell phone service with data
- Choice of multiple participating phone companies
- Basic features included (caller ID, voicemail, etc.)
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check eligibility (must participate in Medi-Cal, CalFresh, SSI, or meet income guidelines)
2. Visit californialifeline.com or call the hotline
3. Choose a participating phone company
4. Submit application with proof of eligibility
5. Receive service within a few weeks of approval

programs.name: Good360
programs.description: Donated technology and goods including laptops, monitors, tablets, and office supplies; availability varies by donor shipments
programs.fullDescription: Good360 is a nonprofit organization that partners with major retailers and manufacturers to distribute donated goods to nonprofits and schools, including technology equipment.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Donated technology including laptops, monitors, tablets
- Office supplies and equipment
- Various retail goods and merchandise
- Availability varies based on donor shipments
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Register your nonprofit organization at good360.org
2. Complete the membership application
3. Pay annual membership fee (varies by organization size)
4. Browse available products in the online catalog
5. Request items and arrange shipping/pickup

programs.name: Goodstack Nonprofit Discounts
programs.description: Offers discounted access to essential software and tech tools like Zoom, Adobe Acrobat, Asana, and OpenAI plans for eligible nonprofit organizations
programs.fullDescription: Goodstack (formerly Percent) is a platform that helps nonprofits access discounted software and technology tools from major companies like Zoom, Adobe, Asana, and OpenAI.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Discounted access to Zoom, Adobe Acrobat, Asana, and more
- OpenAI/ChatGPT plans for nonprofits
- Various SaaS and cloud service discounts
- Centralized platform to manage all nonprofit discounts
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Visit causes.goodstack.io
2. Verify your nonprofit status (501c3 or equivalent)
3. Create an organizational account
4. Browse available discounts and offers
5. Claim discounts directly through the platform

programs.name: Instacart for EBT/SNAP
programs.description: 50% off Instacart+ membership for one year; skip delivery/pickup fees with participating stores; new customers get $0 delivery on first 3 orders
programs.fullDescription: Instacart is a grocery delivery and pickup service. They offer special discounts for EBT/SNAP recipients, making grocery delivery more accessible and affordable.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- 50% off Instacart+ membership for one year
- Skip delivery and pickup fees at participating stores
- New customers get $0 delivery on first 3 orders
- Use EBT/SNAP benefits for eligible food items
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Download the Instacart app or visit instacart.com
2. Create an account
3. Add your EBT card to your payment methods
4. Apply for the discounted Instacart+ membership
5. Start shopping with reduced fees

programs.name: Internet Essentials by Xfinity
programs.description: Affordable home internet + Wi-Fi modem
programs.fullDescription: Internet Essentials is Comcast/Xfinity's low-cost internet program designed to help connect low-income families to affordable high-speed internet at home.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Affordable high-speed internet (up to 50 Mbps)
- WiFi modem included at no extra cost
- No credit check or term contract
- Option to purchase low-cost computer
- Free internet training resources
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check if Xfinity service is available in your area
2. Verify eligibility through SNAP, Medicaid, SSI, public housing, or other programs
3. Apply online at internetessentials.com or by phone
4. Receive equipment and self-install or schedule technician

programs.name: Kanopy for Students
programs.description: Free streaming for college students through participating campus libraries
programs.fullDescription: Kanopy is a video streaming service that partners with libraries and universities to provide free access to thousands of films, documentaries, and educational videos.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free streaming of thousands of films and documentaries
- Criterion Collection, indie films, and world cinema
- Educational and documentary content
- Access through participating campus libraries
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check if your college or university participates
2. Visit kanopy.com/signup/find/university
3. Search for your school
4. Sign in with your campus credentials
5. Start streaming immediately

programs.name: Tech Exchange
programs.description: Refurbished computers and technology equipment for nonprofits and community organizations; also offers digital training and tech support
programs.fullDescription: Tech Exchange is a Bay Area nonprofit that provides affordable refurbished technology to nonprofits, schools, and community organizations, along with digital training and support.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Refurbished computers and laptops at low cost
- Technology equipment for nonprofits and schools
- Digital literacy training programs
- Technical support services
- E-waste recycling
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Visit techexchange.org to browse available equipment
2. Verify your nonprofit or school status
3. Request equipment through the website
4. Schedule pickup at their Oakland location or arrange delivery

programs.name: TechSoup Discount Marketplace
programs.description: Provides access to donated and deeply discounted software, hardware, cloud services, and training for nonprofits by verifying nonprofit status
programs.fullDescription: TechSoup is the leading nonprofit technology assistance organization, helping nonprofits access donated and discounted software, hardware, and cloud services from major tech companies.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Microsoft 365 and Office products at deep discounts
- Adobe Creative Cloud for nonprofits
- Hardware from Dell, Lenovo, and others
- Cloud services from AWS, Google, and Microsoft
- Training and learning resources
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Register your nonprofit at techsoup.org
2. Complete the validation process (verify 501c3 status)
3. Pay small administrative fees for products
4. Browse catalog and request products
5. Receive digital products instantly or hardware by mail

programs.name: T-Mobile Project 10Million
programs.description: Free mobile hotspot device for income-eligible households with K-12 students with 200GB high-speed data per year for 5 years; optional $10/10GB data pass available when data limit is reached; free Web Guard content filtering
programs.fullDescription: T-Mobile Project 10Million is a $10.7 billion initiative to provide free internet connectivity to millions of underserved student households across America, helping close the homework gap.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free mobile hotspot device
- 200GB high-speed data per year for 5 years
- Free Web Guard content filtering for safety
- Optional $10 data pass for additional 10GB when needed
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Household must have K-12 student(s)
2. Must qualify for National School Lunch Program or similar
3. School district or school must participate
4. Apply through your school or district
5. Receive hotspot device and instructions

programs.name: Walmart+ Assist
programs.description: Eligible government assistance recipients receive Walmart+ at 50% off ($6.47/mo. or $49/yr.); new customers start with a free 30-day trial
programs.fullDescription: Walmart+ is Walmart's membership program offering free delivery, fuel discounts, and more. Walmart+ Assist provides this membership at half price for those receiving government assistance.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- 50% off Walmart+ membership ($6.47/month or $49/year)
- Free delivery from your local store (no minimum order)
- Member prices on fuel at Walmart and Murphy stations
- Scan & Go for faster in-store checkout
- Free 30-day trial for new customers
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Visit walmart.com/plus/assist
2. Verify eligibility through SNAP, Medicaid, SSI, TANF, or WIC
3. Complete verification through third-party service
4. Start your discounted membership
5. Re-verify eligibility annually

programs.name: World Computer Exchange
programs.description: Donated computers and technology equipment for educational and nonprofit use; includes multiple Bay Area drop-off locations
programs.fullDescription: World Computer Exchange is a nonprofit that collects donated computers and distributes them to schools, libraries, and community organizations in developing countries and underserved US communities.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Donated computers and technology equipment
- Equipment for educational and nonprofit use
- Multiple Bay Area drop-off locations for donations
- Computers refurbished and distributed to those in need
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Visit worldcomputerexchange.org
2. Complete the request form for your organization
3. Provide documentation of nonprofit or educational status
4. Coordinate pickup or delivery of equipment

programs.name: Spectrum Internet Assist
programs.description: Affordable high-speed internet for households with member participating in National School Lunch Program, Community Eligibility Provision, or receiving SSI (65+)
programs.fullDescription: Spectrum Internet Assist is Charter Communications' affordable internet program for qualifying low-income households, including seniors receiving SSI and families with students in free lunch programs.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Affordable high-speed internet service (30 Mbps)
- No data caps or contracts
- Free modem included
- Free internet security suite
- In-home WiFi available for additional fee
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check if Spectrum service is available in your area
2. Must have student in National School Lunch Program (NSLP) or Community Eligibility Provision (CEP)
3. Or be 65+ and receiving Supplemental Security Income (SSI)
4. Apply online or call Spectrum
5. Cannot have prior Spectrum debt within last 12 months

programs.name: Menlo Park Library Wi-Fi Hotspots
programs.description: Free 7-day checkout of portable Wi-Fi hotspots for library cardholders
programs.fullDescription: The Menlo Park Library offers portable WiFi hotspot devices that library cardholders can borrow, providing free internet access at home or on the go.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free 7-day checkout of portable WiFi hotspot
- High-speed internet access anywhere
- No data limits during checkout period
- Available to all library cardholders
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Get a Menlo Park Library card (free for residents)
2. Check availability of hotspots online or at the library
3. Place a hold or visit the library to check out
4. Return within 7 days to avoid late fees

programs.name: AC Transit
programs.description: Student Transit Pass Program: free unlimited rides for eligible middle and high school students
programs.fullDescription: AC Transit (Alameda-Contra Costa Transit District) is the third-largest public bus system in California, serving the East Bay including Oakland, Berkeley, and surrounding cities with local and transbay service.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Student Transit Pass Program (STPP): Free unlimited rides for eligible middle and high school students
- Program covers all AC Transit local and transbay routes
- Valid throughout the school year
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Program is available through participating school districts
2. Your school will provide information about enrollment
3. Students receive a Clipper card loaded with the pass
4. Contact your school's administration for enrollment details

programs.name: BART
programs.description: High-Value Discount: ~6.25% off when using Autoload
programs.fullDescription: BART (Bay Area Rapid Transit) is a heavy rail rapid transit system serving the San Francisco Bay Area, connecting San Francisco, Oakland, Berkeley, and surrounding suburbs with 50 stations across 131 miles of track.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- High-Value Discount: Approximately 6.25% savings when using Clipper Autoload
- Discount automatically applied when card balance is reloaded
- Works on all BART stations and routes
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Get a Clipper card at any BART station or online
2. Set up Autoload on your Clipper account at clippercard.com
3. Choose an amount to automatically add when balance is low
4. Discount is applied automatically to each Autoload transaction

programs.name: BART + Muni
programs.description: "A" Fast Pass: Unlimited Muni + BART rides within SF
programs.fullDescription: A joint program between BART and SFMTA offering unlimited transit within San Francisco on both systems with a single monthly pass.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- "A" Fast Pass: Unlimited Muni rides plus unlimited BART rides within San Francisco
- Valid on all Muni buses, light rail, cable cars, and historic streetcars
- Valid on BART between San Francisco stations only
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Purchase through Clipper card website or retail locations
2. Load the monthly "A" pass onto your Clipper card
3. Pass is valid for one calendar month
4. Tap Clipper card when boarding Muni or entering BART

programs.name: Bike Share for All (Bay Wheels)
programs.description: Discounted bike share membership for income-eligible riders
programs.fullDescription: Bay Wheels (operated by Lyft) is the Bay Area's bike share system with thousands of bikes available at stations throughout San Francisco, Oakland, Berkeley, and San Jose. Bike Share for All makes it affordable for low-income residents.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Discounted annual membership: $5/year for first year (regularly $149)
- Unlimited 60-minute rides on classic bikes
- Reduced per-minute rates for e-bikes
- No credit card requiredcan pay with cash or prepaid card
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Visit the Bike Share for All website or call customer service
2. Provide proof of eligibility (Clipper START, Calfresh/EBT, or income verification)
3. Complete enrollment online or at a Lyft community hub
4. Receive your membership and start riding

programs.name: Caltrain Dollar Fares for Youth
programs.description: $1 One-Way, $2 Day Pass for youth 18 and under
programs.fullDescription: Caltrain is a commuter rail line running 77 miles along the San Francisco Peninsula, connecting San Francisco to San Jose and Gilroy. The Dollar Fares program makes train travel extremely affordable for young riders.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $1 One-Way fare for youth 18 and under
- $2 Day Pass for unlimited rides in one day
- Valid on all Caltrain routes and zones
- No income requirementsavailable to all youth
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Get a Clipper card with Youth designation at clippercard.com
2. Or show valid ID proving age 18 or under when purchasing tickets
3. Tap Clipper card or show ticket when boarding
4. Youth ages 4 and under ride free with paying adult

programs.name: City Coach
programs.description: Free rides for Solano College students (within Solano Co.)
programs.fullDescription: City Coach is the local public transit service for the City of Vacaville in Solano County, providing fixed-route bus service throughout the city.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free rides for Solano Community College students
- Valid on all City Coach routes within Vacaville
- No additional fees or passes required
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be currently enrolled at Solano Community College
2. Show your valid student ID to the bus driver when boarding
3. No separate application or pass needed

programs.name: Clipper BayPass
programs.description: Unlimited rides on all 24 Bay Area transit agencies
programs.fullDescription: Clipper BayPass is a pilot program providing unlimited transit access across all 24 Bay Area transit agencies on a single pass, designed primarily for college students at participating institutions.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Unlimited rides on all 24 Bay Area transit agencies
- Includes BART, Muni, AC Transit, Caltrain, VTA, and more
- Single pass covers all transit systems
- Significant savings compared to paying per ride
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check if your college or university participates in the program
2. Register through your school's transportation or parking office
3. Link your student ID to a Clipper card
4. Program eligibility and fees vary by institution

programs.name: Clipper START
programs.description: Reduced transit fares
programs.fullDescription: Clipper START is a regional program that provides discounted transit fares for low-income adults on participating Bay Area transit systems, helping make public transportation more accessible.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- 50% off single-ride fares on most participating transit agencies
- 20% off on BART
- Valid on AC Transit, BART, Caltrain, Golden Gate Transit/Ferry, Muni, SamTrans, and more
- Discounts automatically applied when using Clipper card
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check income eligibility (200% or below Federal Poverty Level)
2. Apply online at clipperstartcard.com
3. Provide proof of income or participation in qualifying benefit programs
4. Receive Clipper START card by mail within 2-3 weeks
5. Load cash value and ride with automatic discounts

programs.name: DMV Reduced-Fee ID Card
programs.description: Reduced-fee state ID for eligible residents using form DL 937
programs.fullDescription: The California Department of Motor Vehicles offers reduced-fee identification cards for income-eligible residents, providing an affordable way to obtain government-issued photo ID.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Reduced-fee state ID card (regularly $35, reduced to $8)
- Valid government-issued photo identification
- Can be used for identification purposes, voting, and more
- Available to qualifying low-income residents
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Contact your county's Public Assistance Agency or social services office
2. Request Form DL 937 (Fee Waiver Certification)
3. Agency will verify your eligibility and complete the form
4. Take the certified DL 937 form to any DMV office
5. Complete ID card application and pay reduced fee

programs.name: Emergency Ride Home
programs.description: Reimbursement for eligible emergency rides home (up to $125/ride, capped at $500/year)
programs.fullDescription: Marin Commutes provides emergency ride home reimbursement for people who use alternative transportation to get to work or school, ensuring you can get home quickly in case of an emergency.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Reimbursement for emergency rides home
- Up to $125 per ride
- Maximum $500 per year
- Covers taxi, Uber/Lyft, or rental car costs
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Register with Marin Commutes before needing the service
2. Use alternative transportation (carpool, transit, bike, walk) regularly
3. When emergency occurs, take taxi/rideshare/rental car home
4. Submit reimbursement request online within 5 business days
5. Include receipt and reason for emergency

programs.name: Emery Go-Round
programs.description: Free shuttle service throughout Emeryville
programs.fullDescription: Emery Go-Round is a free shuttle bus service operated by the Emeryville Transportation Management Association, connecting Emeryville destinations with the MacArthur BART station.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Completely free shuttle service
- Multiple routes throughout Emeryville
- Connection to MacArthur BART station
- Frequent service during business hours
- No pass or registration required
programs.howToGetIt:
1. No registration or pass needed
2. Check the route map and schedule online
3. Go to any Emery Go-Round stop
4. Board when shuttle arrivesno fare required

programs.name: 511 Emergency Rides
programs.description: 6 free emergency Lyft/Uber rides annually
programs.fullDescription: 511 Contra Costa provides emergency ride services for commuters who use alternative transportation, ensuring workers and students can get home safely in case of unexpected emergencies.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- 6 free emergency Lyft or Uber rides per year
- Available for qualified emergencies (illness, family emergency, unscheduled overtime)
- Covers ride from school/work to home
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Register with 511 Contra Costa's Guaranteed Ride Home program
2. Must work or attend college in Contra Costa County
3. Use alternative transportation (transit, carpool, bike, walk) at least 2 days/week
4. Request ride through the program when emergency occurs

programs.name: 511 Transit Incentives
programs.description: Free $25 Clipper card for taking transit pledge
programs.fullDescription: 511 Contra Costa offers incentives to encourage workers and students to try public transit, providing free Clipper card value when you commit to taking transit.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free $25 Clipper card for taking the transit pledge
- One-time incentive to try transit
- Can be used on any transit agency that accepts Clipper
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Visit the 511 Contra Costa website
2. Complete the transit pledge online
3. Must work or attend college in Contra Costa County
4. Receive $25 Clipper card by mail or at designated pickup location

programs.name: Lime Access
programs.description: Discounted or free Lime scooter rides (up to a set time per ride) for eligible riders
programs.fullDescription: Lime is a micromobility company offering electric scooters and bikes for short trips. Lime Access makes these transportation options affordable for low-income riders.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Discounted or free Lime scooter and bike rides
- Up to 30 minutes free per ride (varies by market)
- 50% off all rides after free minutes
- Available in Bay Area cities where Lime operates
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Download the Lime app on your smartphone
2. Create an account
3. Apply for Lime Access in the app settings
4. Provide proof of income eligibility (SNAP, Medicaid, LIHEAP, or similar)
5. Approval usually within a few days

programs.name: Low Cost Auto Insurance
programs.description: State-sponsored low-cost liability insurance for income-eligible drivers
programs.fullDescription: California's Low Cost Automobile Insurance Program (CLCA) is a state-sponsored program providing affordable liability insurance for income-eligible drivers who might otherwise go uninsured.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- State-sponsored low-cost liability insurance
- Meets California's minimum insurance requirements
- Annual premiums typically $400-$800 depending on county
- Covers bodily injury and property damage liability
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check income eligibility (250% of Federal Poverty Level or less)
2. Must have valid California driver's license
3. Must own a vehicle valued at $25,000 or less
4. Good driving record required (limited violations allowed)
5. Apply online or by phone
6. Choose from participating insurance companies

programs.name: Marin Transit
programs.description: Free rides for College of Marin students
programs.fullDescription: Marin Transit provides local bus service throughout Marin County, connecting communities with schools, shopping, and employment centers. The agency partners with College of Marin to offer free rides for students.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free rides for College of Marin students
- Valid on all Marin Transit local routes
- No additional fees or passes required
- Show student ID to ride free
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be currently enrolled at College of Marin
2. Obtain your valid student ID from the college
3. Show student ID to bus driver when boarding
4. Ride any Marin Transit local route for free

programs.name: Muni
programs.description: Free Muni for youth (excludes cable cars), income-eligible seniors/people with disabilities, Access Pass, Lifeline Pass, free with Chase Center event ticket
programs.fullDescription: San Francisco Municipal Transportation Agency (SFMTA) operates Muni, the city's public transit system including buses, light rail (Metro), cable cars, and historic streetcars. Multiple free and discounted fare programs are available.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free Muni for Youth (ages 5-18): Free on all Muni except cable cars
- Free Muni for Seniors/Disabled: For income-eligible seniors 65+ and people with disabilities
- Lifeline Pass: Discounted monthly pass for low-income adults
- Free rides with Chase Center event tickets (game day)
- Veterans and military discounts available
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Youth: Apply online at sfmta.com/freemunioryouth
2. Seniors/Disabled: Apply online with proof of age, disability, and income
3. Lifeline Pass: Apply through SFMTA with proof of low income
4. Chase Center: Show your event ticket on game day for free Muni
5. All programs require Clipper card

programs.name: Petaluma Transit
programs.description: All local buses free to ride
programs.fullDescription: Petaluma Transit is the local public bus service for the City of Petaluma in Sonoma County, providing fixed-route service throughout the city and connections to regional transit.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- All local bus routes are completely free
- No fare required for any rider
- Service throughout Petaluma
- Connections to regional transit available
programs.howToGetIt:
1. No registration, pass, or payment needed
2. Check route map and schedule online
3. Go to any Petaluma Transit stop
4. Board when bus arrivescompletely free

programs.name: RTC Clipper Card
programs.description: Reduced fares for riders with disabilities
programs.fullDescription: The Regional Transit Connection (RTC) Clipper Card provides discounted fares for people with disabilities on participating Bay Area transit systems.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Reduced fares on most Bay Area transit agencies
- Typically 50% or more off regular adult fares
- Valid on BART, Muni, AC Transit, Caltrain, and more
- Discounts automatically applied when using RTC Clipper card
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Complete the RTC application at 511.org
2. Provide proof of disability (Medicare card, SSI/SSDI documentation, or medical certification)
3. Submit application online or by mail
4. Once approved, receive RTC Clipper card by mail
5. Load cash value and ride with automatic discounts

programs.name: SamTrans Way2Go Pass
programs.description: FREE unlimited bus pass; transit support for eligible students
programs.fullDescription: SamTrans is San Mateo County's public transit bus service. The Way2Go Pass program provides free unlimited transit for eligible college students through SparkPoint centers.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- FREE unlimited SamTrans bus pass
- Valid on all SamTrans routes
- Additional transit support services available
- Helps students access education and employment
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be enrolled at a participating college (Skyline, Caada, CSM)
2. Visit your campus SparkPoint center
3. Complete program intake and eligibility verification
4. Receive Way2Go pass loaded on Clipper card

programs.name: SamTrans
programs.description: Summer Youth Pass: unlimited local bus rides JuneAugust
programs.fullDescription: SamTrans offers a special Summer Youth Pass for young riders, making it easy and affordable for youth to travel throughout San Mateo County during summer months.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Summer Youth Pass: Unlimited local bus rides June through August
- Valid on all SamTrans local routes
- Affordable flat rate for entire summer
- Great for summer activities, jobs, and recreation
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Purchase Summer Youth Pass before or during summer
2. Available at SamTrans sales outlets and online
3. Must be 18 years old or younger
4. Load pass onto Clipper card
5. Valid June 1 through August 31

programs.name: Santa Rosa CityBus
programs.description: Free rides for youth, children, veterans, SRJC students, some city/county workers
programs.fullDescription: Santa Rosa CityBus provides local public transit service throughout the City of Santa Rosa in Sonoma County, with multiple routes connecting neighborhoods, schools, shopping, and employment centers.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free rides for youth 18 and under
- Free rides for children with paying adult
- Free rides for veterans with valid ID
- Free rides for SRJC students with student ID
- Free rides for some city and county workers
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Youth: Show ID proving age 18 or under
2. Veterans: Show valid military or VA ID
3. SRJC Students: Show current student ID
4. City/County Workers: Show employee ID (if eligible)
5. No separate application neededjust show ID when boarding

programs.name: Senior Clipper Card
programs.description: Discounted fares for 65+
programs.fullDescription: The Senior Clipper Card provides discounted fares for riders 65 and older on participating Bay Area transit systems.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Discounted fares on most Bay Area transit agencies
- Typically 50% off regular adult fares
- Valid on BART, Muni, AC Transit, Caltrain, and more
- Discounts automatically applied when using Senior Clipper card
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Visit clippercard.com to apply online
2. Provide proof of age (65 or older)
3. Valid ID options include driver's license, passport, or Medicare card
4. Receive Senior Clipper card by mail
5. Load cash value or passes and ride with automatic senior discounts

programs.name: CID Borrow a Backup Battery
programs.description: Borrow portable batteries during Public Safety Power Shutoffs for those requiring electricity for medical reasons
programs.fullDescription: The Center for Independence of Individuals with Disabilities (CID) provides portable backup batteries to individuals who depend on electricity for medical equipment during Public Safety Power Shutoffs (PSPS).
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Portable backup battery loans during PSPS events
- Batteries sized for medical equipment (CPAP, oxygen, etc.)
- No cost to borrow
- Priority support for Medical Baseline customers
- Advance notification of PSPS events
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Enroll in PG&E's Medical Baseline program
2. Register with CID's PSPS preparedness program
3. Provide medical documentation of equipment needs
4. When PSPS is announced, contact CID to arrange battery pickup
5. Return battery after power is restored
programs.address: 2001 Winward Way, Suite 103, San Mateo, CA 94404

programs.name: CleanPowerSF
programs.description: Additional bill-relief options for qualifying customers
programs.fullDescription: CleanPowerSF is San Francisco's community choice energy program that provides 100% renewable electricity to residents and businesses, with additional bill relief options for qualifying low-income customers.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- 100% renewable electricity at competitive rates
- Automatic enrollment for SF residents and businesses
- Bill relief programs for low-income customers
- SuperGreen option for 100% CA solar/wind
- Combined savings with PG&E CARE/FERA programs
programs.howToGetIt:
1. CleanPowerSF enrollment is automatic for SF residents
2. For bill relief, enroll in PG&E's CARE or FERA program
3. CARE/FERA discounts apply to both PG&E delivery and CleanPowerSF generation
4. Contact CleanPowerSF for additional assistance options
5. Low-income customers can request rate comparisons

programs.name: EBMUD Customer Assistance Program
programs.description: 35-50% discount on water and wastewater bills for income-eligible customers
programs.fullDescription: The East Bay Municipal Utility District (EBMUD) Customer Assistance Program provides significant discounts on water and wastewater bills for income-eligible households in Alameda and Contra Costa counties.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- 35% discount on water and wastewater bills (Tier 1)
- 50% discount for households at 100% federal poverty level (Tier 2)
- Crisis assistance for customers facing shutoff
- Flexible payment arrangements
- Free leak detection assistance
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check income eligibility (based on federal poverty guidelines)
2. Download application from EBMUD website or call to request
3. Provide proof of income (tax return, benefit letter, pay stubs)
4. Submit application by mail, email, or in person
5. Renew every two years to maintain discount

programs.name: LIHEAP
programs.description: Up to $3,000 per year to help pay energy bills, avoid disconnection, and pay for energy efficiency improvements and energy-related home repairs
programs.fullDescription: The Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) is a federally funded program that helps low-income households pay their energy bills and make energy-efficient home improvements.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $3,000 per year for energy bill assistance
- Help preventing utility disconnection
- Energy efficiency improvements (weatherization)
- Energy-related home repairs
- Crisis assistance for emergencies
- Assistance with heating and cooling costs
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Find your local LIHEAP provider through CSD website
2. Check income eligibility (typically 60% of state median income)
3. Gather documents: ID, utility bills, income verification
4. Submit application through local Community Action Agency
5. If approved, payment goes directly to utility company

programs.name: Medical Baseline Allowance
programs.description: Extra low-cost energy allowance for customers with qualifying medical conditions requiring additional electricity or gas (including CPAP); also get alerted before Public Safety Power Shutoffs
programs.fullDescription: The Medical Baseline Allowance program provides additional low-cost energy to customers with qualifying medical conditions that require extra electricity or gas, and includes priority notification before power shutoffs.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Additional baseline energy at lowest tier rates
- 500 extra kWh of electricity per month
- 25 extra therms of gas per month (for heating)
- Advance notification of Public Safety Power Shutoffs (PSPS)
- Protection from disconnection during extreme weather
- Eligibility for free portable battery program
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Have doctor complete Medical Baseline certification form
2. Qualifying conditions include: life-support equipment, heating/cooling for medical conditions, CPAP/BiPAP, electric wheelchair, etc.
3. Submit form to your utility provider (PG&E, SCE, SDG&E, etc.)
4. Recertify every 2 years (or as required)
5. Contact utility immediately if medical equipment is affected by outage

programs.name: E-Bike Rebate
programs.description: Up to $1,000 rebate for electric bike; must participate in CARE or FERA program; can combine with other e-bike rebates
programs.fullDescription: Peninsula Clean Energy offers e-bike rebates to help income-qualified San Mateo County residents transition to clean transportation, reducing both costs and carbon emissions.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $1,000 rebate for new electric bicycle
- Available to CARE or FERA program participants
- Can combine with state CARB e-bike rebate
- Works with most e-bike retailers
- Covers standard and cargo e-bikes
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be a Peninsula Clean Energy customer
2. Must be enrolled in PG&E's CARE or FERA program
3. Purchase a new qualifying electric bicycle
4. Submit rebate application with proof of purchase
5. Receive rebate check within 6-8 weeks

programs.name: Heat Pump Heating & Cooling Rebate
programs.description: $1,500 rebate to replace gas heater/furnace with electric heat pump; CARE customers get additional $1,000
programs.fullDescription: Peninsula Clean Energy offers rebates for San Mateo County residents to replace gas furnaces with efficient electric heat pumps that provide both heating and cooling.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $1,500 base rebate for heat pump installation
- Additional $1,000 for CARE/FERA customers ($2,500 total)
- Replaces gas furnace with electric heat pump
- Provides both heating and air conditioning
- Can combine with BayREN and federal incentives
- Access to vetted contractor network
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Verify you're a Peninsula Clean Energy customer
2. Get quotes from licensed HVAC contractors
3. Choose a qualifying heat pump system
4. Complete installation with required permits
5. Submit rebate application with documentation
6. Receive rebate check after approval

programs.name: Home Upgrade Services
programs.description: No-cost installation services for income-eligible single-family homeowners to convert gas appliances to electric; includes assessment, pre-vetted contractor, permits, rebates, and fixed pricing
programs.fullDescription: Peninsula Clean Energy's Home Upgrade Services provides no-cost electrification for income-eligible homeowners, converting gas appliances to electric with a full-service approach from assessment to installation.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free in-home energy assessment
- No-cost installation of electric appliances
- Heat pump water heaters and HVAC systems
- Induction cooktops and electric dryers
- Electrical panel upgrades if needed
- All permits and inspections handled
- Pre-vetted, quality contractors
- Fixed, transparent pricing
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Complete online eligibility survey
2. Must own single-family home in San Mateo County
3. Meet income guidelines (typically 80% AMI or below)
4. Schedule free in-home assessment
5. Review and approve recommended upgrades
6. PCE coordinates installation and rebates

programs.name: Used Electric Vehicle Rebate
programs.description: $2,000 toward purchase of used plug-in hybrid or fully-electric vehicle from dealer; can combine with other rebates and tax credits
programs.fullDescription: Peninsula Clean Energy helps income-qualified San Mateo County residents afford electric vehicles with a $2,000 rebate toward used plug-in hybrids or fully-electric vehicles.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $2,000 rebate for used EV purchase
- Covers plug-in hybrid and fully-electric vehicles
- Must purchase from licensed dealer
- Can combine with federal tax credits
- Can combine with other state/local rebates
- Stackable with Clean Cars for All program
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Verify you're a Peninsula Clean Energy customer
2. Confirm income eligibility (CARE/FERA enrollment)
3. Purchase qualifying used EV from licensed dealer
4. Apply within 180 days of purchase
5. Submit proof of purchase and vehicle registration
6. Receive rebate check after approval

programs.name: Water Heater Rebate
programs.description: Up to $4,000 rebate for replacing water heater with electric heat pump ($500 for electric replacement, $2,500 for gas replacement, plus $1,000 for CARE customers and $1,000 for electrical panel upgrade)
programs.fullDescription: Peninsula Clean Energy offers substantial rebates for San Mateo County residents to replace gas or electric water heaters with efficient heat pump water heaters.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $2,500 rebate for replacing gas water heater
- $500 rebate for replacing electric resistance water heater
- Additional $1,000 for CARE/FERA customers
- Additional $1,000 for electrical panel upgrade
- Up to $4,000 total rebate possible
- Can combine with zero-interest loan program
- Access to pre-vetted contractors
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Verify you're a Peninsula Clean Energy customer
2. Get quotes from licensed plumbers/contractors
3. Choose a qualifying heat pump water heater
4. Complete installation with required permits
5. Submit rebate application with documentation
6. Optional: Apply for zero-interest loan for remaining costs

programs.name: Zero Interest Loan for Upgrades
programs.description: Up to $10,000 zero-interest loan for electric heat pump water heaters, heating/AC, electrical panel, and energy efficiency upgrades; no money down, 5-year term
programs.fullDescription: Peninsula Clean Energy offers zero-interest financing to help San Mateo County residents electrify their homes without upfront costs, with convenient repayment through monthly utility bills.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $10,000 zero-interest loan
- No money down required
- 5-year repayment term
- Covers heat pump water heaters
- Covers heat pump HVAC systems
- Covers electrical panel upgrades
- Covers energy efficiency improvements
- Repayment on monthly electric bill
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be a Peninsula Clean Energy customer
2. Choose qualifying electrification project
3. Get quotes from licensed contractors
4. Apply for financing through PCE
5. Complete installation
6. Loan payments added to monthly electric bill

programs.name: Arrearage Management Plan (AMP)
programs.description: Save up to $8,000 on overdue utility bills for CARE customers; must owe at least $500 and be more than 90 days past due
programs.fullDescription: PG&E's Arrearage Management Plan helps CARE-enrolled customers reduce their past-due utility debt by forgiving up to $8,000 over 12 months when they make consistent on-time payments.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $8,000 in debt forgiveness
- 1/12 of debt forgiven each month
- Must make on-time payments for 12 months
- Prevents disconnection while enrolled
- Can re-enroll if you fall behind
- Works alongside CARE discount
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be enrolled in PG&E CARE program
2. Must owe at least $500 on your account
3. Account must be more than 90 days past due
4. Contact PG&E or apply online to enroll
5. Make on-time monthly payments for 12 months
6. 1/12 of your debt is forgiven each month you pay on time

programs.name: Automated Response Technology Program
programs.description: Get paid $25 to enroll smart devices (thermostats, batteries, EV chargers) for energy optimization; monthly lottery for $500 prize
programs.fullDescription: PG&E's Automated Response Technology Program rewards customers for enrolling smart home devices that can automatically adjust energy use during peak demand periods, helping stabilize the grid.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $25 enrollment bonus per device
- Monthly lottery entry for $500 prize
- Eligible devices: smart thermostats, batteries, EV chargers
- Automatic adjustments during peak times
- Helps reduce energy costs
- Supports grid reliability
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be a PG&E residential customer
2. Own a compatible smart device (Nest, ecobee, Tesla, etc.)
3. Device must be connected to Wi-Fi
4. Enroll through PG&E's website or app
5. Allow device to auto-adjust during demand events
6. Receive $25 bonus and lottery entries

programs.name: PG&E CARE & FERA
programs.description: 35% discount on electricity bills and 20% on natural gas through CARE; enrollment also qualifies for more incentives from other programs
programs.fullDescription: PG&E's CARE (California Alternate Rates for Energy) and FERA (Family Electric Rate Assistance) programs provide significant utility bill discounts for income-qualified households.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- CARE: 35% discount on electricity, 20% on natural gas
- FERA: 18% discount on electricity for larger households
- Gateway to many other programs and rebates
- Protection from service disconnection during extreme weather
- Eligibility for Medical Baseline if medically necessary
- Automatic re-enrollment every 2 years
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check income eligibility (based on household size and income)
2. CARE: Income at or below 200% federal poverty level
3. FERA: 3+ person household, slightly higher income limits
4. Apply online at pge.com/care
5. Or call PG&E or submit mail-in application
6. Provide income verification if requested

programs.name: CPUC Energy Savings Assistance (ESA) Program
programs.description: Free home upgrades and repairs including heat pump water heaters, furnaces, lighting, refrigerators; all at no charge for income-eligible customers
programs.fullDescription: The Energy Savings Assistance Program provides free home energy upgrades and weatherization services to income-qualified households, helping reduce energy bills and improve comfort.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free energy assessment of your home
- LED lighting upgrades
- New energy-efficient refrigerator
- Weatherization (insulation, caulking, weather stripping)
- HVAC repairs or replacement
- Heat pump water heater installation
- Smart power strips
- All services and equipment at no cost
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check income eligibility (typically 200% federal poverty level)
2. Contact PG&E to request free assessment
3. Technician visits home to evaluate needs
4. Receive free installation of qualifying upgrades
5. Renters and homeowners both eligible
6. May qualify through CARE enrollment

programs.name: Generator & Battery Rebate
programs.description: $300 rebate on purchase of generator or battery storage for power outage preparedness; must be in Tier 2 or 3 High Fire-Threat District and enrolled in CARE or FERA
programs.fullDescription: PG&E provides rebates for generators and portable battery storage to help customers in high fire-threat areas prepare for power outages during Public Safety Power Shutoffs.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $300 rebate on generator purchase
- $300 rebate on portable battery storage
- For customers in Tier 2 or 3 High Fire-Threat Districts
- Must be enrolled in CARE or FERA
- Helps maintain power during PSPS events
- One rebate per household per year
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Verify you're in Tier 2 or 3 High Fire-Threat District
2. Must be enrolled in CARE or FERA program
3. Purchase qualifying generator or battery
4. Apply online within 90 days of purchase
5. Submit proof of purchase and CARE/FERA enrollment
6. Receive rebate check

programs.name: Home Battery Rebate (SGIP)
programs.description: 85% discount on backup battery storage ($850 per kWh) through CPUC's Self-Generation Incentive Program Equity program
programs.fullDescription: The Self-Generation Incentive Program (SGIP) Equity program provides substantial incentives for income-qualified households to install home battery storage, covering up to 85% of the cost.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- 85% discount on battery storage systems
- $850 per kWh incentive
- Covers Tesla Powerwall, Enphase, and other brands
- Backup power during outages
- Can pair with solar for maximum savings
- Priority for Medical Baseline customers
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must meet income eligibility (CARE/FERA or similar)
2. Work with SGIP-registered contractor
3. Contractor submits application on your behalf
4. Get approved before installation
5. Install qualifying battery storage system
6. Incentive applied to project cost

programs.name: Induction Cooktop Test Drive
programs.description: Borrow induction cooktop unit for two weeks; includes cooktop, pan, and instructions with return shipping label
programs.fullDescription: PG&E's Induction Cooktop Test Drive lets customers try induction cooking at home before making a purchase decision, with a free two-week loaner including everything needed to get started.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free two-week induction cooktop loan
- Portable single-burner induction unit
- Induction-compatible pan included
- Instructions and cooking tips
- Pre-paid return shipping label
- No cost or obligation to buy
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be a PG&E customer
2. Visit the Induction Loaner Library website
3. Reserve an available induction cooktop
4. Receive unit by mail
5. Try it for two weeks
6. Return using included shipping label

programs.name: PG&E Match My Payment Program
programs.description: PG&E matches every dollar you pay up to $1,000 toward past due balance; must have at least $100 past due
programs.fullDescription: PG&E's Match My Payment Program helps customers reduce past-due balances by matching every dollar they pay, up to $1,000, effectively cutting their debt in half.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- PG&E matches your payments dollar-for-dollar
- Up to $1,000 in matching funds
- Pay $500, PG&E pays $500 for you
- Helps clear past-due balances faster
- One-time program (once per account)
- Available while funds last
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be a PG&E residential customer
2. Must have at least $100 past due balance
3. Meet income eligibility requirements
4. Contact PG&E to check availability and enroll
5. Make payments toward your balance
6. PG&E matches each payment up to $1,000 total

programs.name: Permanent Battery Storage Rebate
programs.description: $7,500 rebate on permanent battery storage; must have experienced 5+ Enhanced Powerline Safety Settings outages since January 1, 2023; must be enrolled in Automated Demand Response and on time-of-use rate plan
programs.fullDescription: PG&E offers a substantial rebate for permanent home battery storage to customers who have experienced frequent Enhanced Powerline Safety Settings (EPSS) outages, helping them maintain power reliability.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $7,500 rebate for permanent battery storage
- For customers with 5+ EPSS outages since Jan 2023
- Must enroll in Automated Demand Response
- Must be on time-of-use rate plan
- Can combine with SGIP incentives
- Covers Tesla Powerwall, Enphase, and other systems
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Use PG&E lookup tool to check EPSS outage history
2. Must have 5+ outages since January 1, 2023
3. Enroll in Automated Demand Response program
4. Switch to time-of-use rate plan
5. Apply and get approved before installation
6. Install qualifying battery storage system

programs.name: Portable Battery Program
programs.description: Free portable battery for Medical Baseline or Self-Identified Vulnerable customers who rely on medical devices and experienced PSPS or EPSS outages
programs.fullDescription: PG&E provides free portable backup batteries to customers who depend on electricity for medical equipment and have experienced power shutoffs, ensuring they can maintain critical care during outages.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free portable backup battery
- For Medical Baseline customers
- For Self-Identified Vulnerable customers
- Powers medical devices during outages
- For those who experienced PSPS or EPSS outages
- Battery shipped directly to your home
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be enrolled in Medical Baseline program
2. Or registered as Self-Identified Vulnerable customer
3. Must rely on electricity for medical equipment
4. Must have experienced PSPS or EPSS outage
5. Apply through PG&E website or call
6. Battery shipped to your address at no cost

programs.name: Relief for Energy Assistance through Community Help (REACH)
programs.description: Up to $300 energy credit for past-due bills if received 15-day or 48-hour disconnection notice for income-eligible customers; can apply once per 12 months
programs.fullDescription: The REACH program provides emergency bill assistance for PG&E customers facing disconnection, offering up to $300 to help income-eligible households avoid losing power or gas service.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $300 energy bill credit
- Helps prevent service disconnection
- For customers who received shutoff notice
- Available once every 12 months
- Payment goes directly to PG&E bill
- Can combine with other assistance programs
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be income-eligible (up to 200% federal poverty level)
2. Must have received 15-day or 48-hour disconnection notice
3. Apply online or call REACH hotline
4. Provide proof of income if requested
5. Credit applied directly to your PG&E account
6. Can reapply after 12 months if needed

programs.name: Residential Charging Solutions Rebate
programs.description: Up to 100% rebate to cover full cost of PG&E-approved EV charging equipment installed by licensed California electrician
programs.fullDescription: PG&E's Residential Charging Solutions Rebate covers up to 100% of the cost of home EV charging equipment and installation for income-qualified customers, making electric vehicle ownership more accessible.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Up to 100% rebate on EV charger cost
- Covers installation by licensed electrician
- PG&E-approved charging equipment
- Available for CARE/FERA customers
- Level 2 charging capability
- Faster home charging than standard outlet
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be enrolled in CARE or FERA program
2. Must own or lease an electric vehicle
3. Choose PG&E-approved charging equipment
4. Hire licensed California electrician
5. Complete installation and inspection
6. Apply for rebate with documentation

programs.name: Used Electric Vehicle Rebate
programs.description: $4,000 rebate for pre-owned Battery Electric or Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicle from dealers or private parties; can combine with other incentives
programs.fullDescription: PG&E offers a $4,000 rebate for income-qualified customers purchasing pre-owned electric vehicles, making EVs more affordable whether buying from dealers or private sellers.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $4,000 rebate for used EV purchase
- Covers Battery Electric Vehicles (BEV)
- Covers Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicles (PHEV)
- Purchase from dealer or private party
- Can combine with federal tax credits
- Can combine with other state/local rebates
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be a PG&E customer
2. Meet income eligibility (CARE/FERA or income-qualified)
3. Purchase or lease qualifying used EV
4. Apply within 180 days of purchase
5. Submit proof of purchase and registration
6. Receive rebate after approval

programs.name: Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X) Pilot Program
programs.description: $2,500-$4,000 rebate for two-way charger to power home from EV battery; additional $1,500 for early adopters
programs.fullDescription: PG&E's V2X pilot program provides rebates for bidirectional EV chargers that can power your home using your electric vehicle's battery during outages or peak demand periods.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $2,500-$4,000 rebate for V2X charger
- Additional $1,500 for early adopters
- Powers home from EV battery
- Backup power during outages
- Can sell energy back to grid
- Compatible with select EVs (Ford F-150 Lightning, etc.)
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must be a PG&E residential customer
2. Own a V2X-compatible electric vehicle
3. Purchase approved bidirectional charger
4. Hire licensed electrician for installation
5. Apply through PG&E's V2X portal
6. Receive rebate after installation verification

programs.name: WatterSaver
programs.description: $50 to enroll wifi-enabled smart electric water heater and $5/month to participate; shifts water heating to lower cost times
programs.fullDescription: WatterSaver is a demand response program that pays customers to enroll their smart electric water heaters, automatically shifting water heating to off-peak times to save money and support the grid.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $50 enrollment bonus
- $5 per month for participation
- Automatic water heating optimization
- Shifts heating to lower-cost times
- No change to hot water availability
- Smart control via Wi-Fi
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must have Wi-Fi-enabled electric water heater
2. Compatible brands include Rheem, A.O. Smith, Bradford White
3. Sign up on WatterSaver website
4. Connect water heater to Wi-Fi
5. Receive $50 enrollment bonus
6. Earn $5/month ongoing (program currently on hold)

programs.name: Clean Cars for All - EV
programs.description: $10,000-$12,000 rebate to buy or lease new or used battery electric car when trading in pre-2008 gas/diesel vehicle; plus up to $2,000 for EV charger
programs.fullDescription: The Bay Area Air Quality Management District's Clean Cars for All program provides substantial incentives for income-qualified residents to replace older polluting vehicles with new or used electric vehicles.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $10,000-$12,000 rebate for EV purchase or lease
- New or used battery electric vehicles qualify
- Additional $2,000 for home EV charger
- Trade in pre-2008 gas or diesel vehicle
- Covers purchase or lease up to 4 years
- Can combine with federal tax credits
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must live in Bay Area (9-county region)
2. Household income at or below 400% federal poverty level
3. Own a registered pre-2008 gas/diesel vehicle
4. Vehicle must be running and pass smog
5. Apply and get pre-approved BEFORE purchase
6. Trade in old vehicle and buy/lease qualifying EV
programs.address: 375 Beale Street, Suite 600, San Francisco, CA 94105

programs.name: Clean Cars for All - Fuel Cell Vehicle
programs.description: $10,000 rebate to buy or lease new or used fuel cell car when trading in pre-2007 gas/diesel vehicle
programs.fullDescription: The Clean Cars for All program also offers rebates for hydrogen fuel cell vehicles, providing another zero-emission option for Bay Area residents replacing older polluting vehicles.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $10,000 rebate for fuel cell vehicle
- New or used fuel cell vehicles qualify
- Trade in pre-2007 gas or diesel vehicle
- Covers purchase or lease
- Zero emissions, hydrogen-powered
- Can combine with other incentives
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must live in Bay Area (9-county region)
2. Household income at or below 400% federal poverty level
3. Own a registered pre-2007 gas/diesel vehicle
4. Vehicle must be running and pass smog
5. Apply and get pre-approved BEFORE purchase
6. Trade in old vehicle and buy/lease fuel cell vehicle
programs.address: 375 Beale Street, Suite 600, San Francisco, CA 94105

programs.name: Clean Cars for All - E-Bike & Transit Credit
programs.description: $7,500 for electric bike and Bay Area transit service when trading in pre-2008 gas/diesel vehicle
programs.fullDescription: For those who don't need a car, Clean Cars for All offers a mobility option combining an e-bike and transit credits, providing sustainable transportation alternatives when trading in an older vehicle.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $7,500 total value mobility package
- Electric bicycle included
- Bay Area transit credit/passes
- Trade in pre-2008 gas or diesel vehicle
- Supports car-free lifestyle
- Covers multiple transit agencies
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must live in Bay Area (9-county region)
2. Household income at or below 400% federal poverty level
3. Own a registered pre-2008 gas/diesel vehicle
4. Vehicle must be running and pass smog
5. Apply and get pre-approved
6. Trade in old vehicle and receive e-bike + transit credits
programs.address: 375 Beale Street, Suite 600, San Francisco, CA 94105

programs.name: Vehicle Buy Back Program
programs.description: $2,000 to turn in working older car or small truck (2000 or older) for scrapping; must be registered in Bay Area for 2 years
programs.fullDescription: BAAQMD's Vehicle Buy Back program pays $2,000 for older vehicles to be scrapped, reducing air pollution from high-emitting cars while providing owners compensation for retiring their vehicles.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $2,000 payment for your old vehicle
- Vehicle must be year 2000 or older
- Cars and small trucks eligible
- Vehicle must be running
- No income requirements
- Open to all Bay Area residents
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Must own vehicle for at least 2 years
2. Vehicle registered in Bay Area for 2+ years
3. Vehicle must be year 2000 or older
4. Must be in running condition
5. Contact BAAQMD to schedule inspection
6. If approved, receive $2,000 and vehicle is scrapped
programs.address: 375 Beale Street, Suite 600, San Francisco, CA 94105

programs.name: Wood Stove Replacement Program
programs.description: Up to $10,500 to replace wood-burning stove with electric heat pump ($6,500 base + $4,000 for Food Stamps/WIC/SSI recipients); or up to $1,000 for removal only; preference for disadvantaged communities
programs.fullDescription: BAAQMD's Wood Stove Replacement Program helps Bay Area residents replace wood-burning stoves with clean electric heat pumps, improving air quality and reducing home heating costs.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $6,500 base incentive for heat pump replacement
- Additional $4,000 for Food Stamps/WIC/SSI recipients
- Up to $10,500 total for income-qualified households
- Up to $1,000 for removal only (no replacement)
- Priority for disadvantaged communities
- Covers installation costs
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Sign up for program notifications on BAAQMD website
2. Must have wood-burning stove or fireplace
3. Apply when program reopens (January 13, 2026)
4. Submit income documentation if claiming additional rebate
5. Get approved and schedule installation
6. Receive incentive after project completion
programs.address: 375 Beale Street, Suite 600, San Francisco, CA 94105

programs.name: E-Bike Rebate
programs.description: Up to $2,000 point-of-sale discount for new electric bicycle
programs.fullDescription: The California Air Resources Board (CARB) E-Bike Incentive Project provides substantial point-of-sale discounts for income-qualified residents to purchase new electric bicycles.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $2,000 instant discount on new e-bike
- Point-of-sale reduction (no waiting for rebate)
- Covers standard and cargo e-bikes
- Additional for adaptive e-bikes
- Available at participating retailers
- Vouchers released in rounds
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Sign up for email notifications on CARB website
2. When vouchers available, apply online quickly
3. Meet income eligibility (typically 300% federal poverty level)
4. Receive voucher code if selected
5. Use voucher at participating e-bike retailer
6. Discount applied at checkout

programs.name: Old Vehicle Retirement
programs.description: $1,500-$2,000 to retire gas/diesel vehicle that failed smog check ($2,000 if failed most recent inspection)
programs.fullDescription: California's Consumer Assistance Program offers payment to retire vehicles that have failed smog inspections, helping low-income residents get problem vehicles off the road.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- $1,500 for vehicles that failed previous smog check
- $2,000 for vehicles that failed most recent inspection
- Vehicle must be retired (scrapped)
- No repair required before retiring
- Payment issued after vehicle retirement
- Helps reduce air pollution
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Vehicle must have failed a smog check
2. Check income eligibility on BAR website
3. Must have owned and registered vehicle for 2+ years
4. Submit application through Bureau of Automotive Repair
5. Get vehicle dismantled at authorized facility
6. Receive payment after retirement confirmation

programs.name: Driving Clean Assistance Program: Clean Cars 4 All
programs.description: Up to $10,000 + $2,000 charge card or $7,500 mobility option for trading in old gas car; includes down payment assistance, financial counseling, and lender referral
programs.fullDescription: The Driving Clean Assistance Program provides comprehensive support for income-qualified Californians to trade in old gas vehicles for clean alternatives, including financial counseling and down payment help.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $10,000 toward clean vehicle purchase
- Additional $2,000 charging/fueling card
- Alternative: $7,500 mobility option (e-bike + transit)
- Down payment assistance
- Financial counseling services
- Lender referrals for financing
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check income eligibility on DCAP website
2. MUST apply BEFORE trading in your car
3. Vehicle must meet age and emissions requirements
4. Complete application with income documentation
5. Get pre-approved before vehicle purchase
6. Trade in old vehicle and purchase/lease clean vehicle

programs.name: Home EV Charger Federal Tax Credit
programs.description: 30% tax credit up to $1,000 for installing EV charger at home in eligible areas; must install before June 30, 2026
programs.fullDescription: The federal 30C tax credit provides a 30% tax credit for installing electric vehicle charging equipment at home, available in eligible low-income and rural census tracts.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- 30% tax credit on EV charger installation
- Up to $1,000 maximum credit
- Covers charger equipment and installation
- Available in eligible census tracts
- Reduces federal income tax owed
- Applies to primary and secondary homes
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Check if your address is in eligible census tract
2. Use Rewiring America eligibility map tool
3. Purchase and install EV charging equipment
4. Keep all receipts and documentation
5. File IRS Form 8911 with tax return
6. Credit reduces your tax liability

programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
programs.description: Free energy efficiency upgrades to cut bills for low-income homeowners and renters
programs.fullDescription: California's Weatherization Assistance Program provides free energy efficiency upgrades to help low-income households reduce energy costs and improve home comfort and safety.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- Free home energy audit
- Insulation (attic, wall, floor)
- Air sealing and weatherstripping
- Heating system repairs or replacement
- Water heater repairs or replacement
- Minor home repairs for energy efficiency
- All services at no cost
programs.howToGetIt:
1. Find your local weatherization provider
2. Check income eligibility (typically 200% federal poverty level)
3. Submit application with income documentation
4. Technician conducts home energy audit
5. Eligible improvements installed at no cost
6. Both homeowners and renters can apply

programs.name: Efficiency and Sustainable Energy (EASE) Home Program
programs.description: BayREN covers 80% of cost for home efficiency measures (insulation, duct sealing); your share not to exceed $1,000; includes help with other rebates and fixed pricing with vetted contractors
programs.fullDescription: BayREN's EASE Home Program covers 80% of home efficiency upgrade costs for income-qualified Bay Area homeowners, with a capped out-of-pocket maximum and vetted contractors.
programs.whatTheyOffer:
- 80% of upgrade costs covered by BayREN
- Your share capped at $1,000 maximum
- Insulation upgrades
- Duct sealing and HVAC improvements
- Help applying for additional rebates
- Fixed pricing with pre-vetted contractors
